etymology.description: 次(次) (cì, 'next') phonetic + 口(口) (kǒu, 'mouth') semantic = 咨(咨) ('to sigh')
etymology.interpretation: The character 咨(咨) combines 口(口) (kǒu, 'mouth'), indicating an action related to the mouth, with the phonetic component 次(次) (cì, 'next'), suggesting the pronunciation. This structure makes intuitive sense as it conveys an action involving the mouth, represented by a sound-related component.

examples.chinese: 面对离别时刻(面對離別時刻)，她不禁长声咨叹(她不禁長聲咨嘆)。
examples.pinyin: Miàn duì líbié shí kè, tā bù jīn cháng shēng zī tàn.
examples.english: Facing the moment of farewell, she couldn't help but sigh deeply.

examples.chinese: 经历辛苦工作后(經歷辛苦工作後)，他坐在窗前静静咨叹(他坐在窗前靜靜咨嘆)。
examples.pinyin: Jīng lì xīn kǔ gōng zuò hòu, tā zuò zài chuāng qián jìng jìng zī tàn.
examples.english: After enduring hard work, he sat by the window, quietly sighing.
